snippet.title: Rival's revenge as Bolt upstaged in farewell
snippet.content: US veteran Justin Gatlin was booed after he stunned Usain Bolt to win the 100m world title in London. Gatlin, who served a doping ban between 2006-10 and won silvers behind Bolt at the last two world championships, clocked 9.92 seconds, with teammate Christian Coleman winning silver in 9.94sec. Bolt suffered a dreadful start and could only claim bronze in 9.95sec. MORE TO COME Originally published as
